subject: Data
title: 3D Charts: Looking Cool, Lying Constantly
description: One-minute skill: 3D Charts: Looking Cool, Lying Constantly.

hook.text: A 3D bar chart in a quarterly report makes Q3 look massive. It's actually the same as Q2.

buildup.text: 3D effects add perspective distortion â€” bars in the back appear smaller, front bars appear larger.

discovery.text: Research shows that 3D charts increase misinterpretation by up to 50% compared to 2D versions.

twist.text: Software defaults still offer 3D options prominently. Excel's 3D pie chart is a data crime in a click.

climax.text: Every data visualization expert agrees: 3D adds nothing but confusion to statistical charts.

punchline.text: 3D charts don't add a dimension. They remove clarity.

quiz.question: Why are 3D charts problematic for data accuracy?
options: Perspective distortion makes values hard to compare
